meanings.sent1: She tried to elasticize the rubber band by pulling it gently.
meanings.sent2: The fabric will elasticize when washed in warm water.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to elasticize the rope to perform his trick.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to elasticize the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The yoga instructor demonstrated how to elasticize the muscles through stretching exercises.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the old rubber band started to elasticize and lose its stretch.
meanings.sent2: The material will elasticize as it adjusts to the temperature changes.
meanings.sent3: The balloon seemed to elasticize as it filled with air, ready to pop.
meanings.sent4: Her heart began to elasticize with hope as she waited for the good news.
meanings.sent5: The elastic band will elasticize when pulled, returning to its original shape.

meanings.sent1: He needed to elasticize the waistband of his pants to make them fit comfortably.
meanings.sent2: The balloon started to elasticize as more air was blown into it.
meanings.sent3: The bubble gum seemed to elasticize endlessly as the child blew bigger bubbles.
meanings.sent4: The city began to elasticize its boundaries to accommodate the growing population.
meanings.sent5: The rubber band can elasticize to twice its original length without breaking.
